params._arbitrator: Target global arbitrator for any disputes.

createDispute(bytes,string,uint256).details: TRUSTED. Calls createDispute function of the specified arbitrator to create a dispute. Note that we don’t need to check that msg.value is enough to pay arbitration fees as it’s the responsibility of the arbitrator contract.

params._arbitratorExtraData: Extra data for the arbitrator of the dispute.
params._metaevidenceURI: Link to metaevidence of the dispute.

returns.disputeID: Dispute id (on arbitrator side) of the created dispute.

rule(uint256,uint256).details: To be called by the arbitrator of the dispute, to declare the winning ruling.

params._externalDisputeID: ID of the dispute in arbitrator contract.
params._ruling: The ruling choice of the arbitration.

devdoc.title: DisputeResolver  DisputeResolver contract adapted for V2 https://github.com/kleros/arbitrable-proxy-contracts/blob/master/contracts/ArbitrableProxy.sol.
